sentence.Network_en: Taxidermy Began with the ancient custom of keeping trophies of the hunt.
sentence.Network_cn: 动物标本剥制术其应用可追溯到古代保藏猎物的风俗.

PerfectNetExp.abs: ... mayonnaise n. 蛋黄酱 taxidermy n. 动物标本剥制术 quarantine n. 检疫, 隔离.
taxidermal 剥制术的taxidermy 标本剥制术taximan 出租车司机
...John Edmonstone）那里学到动物标本的剥制技术（taxidermy），而且这位被解放的黑奴，也教导他许多关于南美热带雨林的传说。
动物标本剥制术(Taxidermy),是一门保存哺乳动物、鸟类、爬行动物、两栖动物和鱼类的艺术,是一门制作栩栩如生的动物复制品的艺术,主要目的是供博物馆展览和私人收藏.

list.abs: my skills improved , and I won the world championship for fish taxidermy in 2003 .我的技能得到了改进，我在2003年获得了鱼标本世界锦标赛冠军。
...27日，美国纽约的一堂拟人化老鼠标本制作课程上，一名学生在摆弄她的老鼠标本。近日，纽约开始风行一种“拟人标本”（anthropomorphic taxidermy）制作的娱乐活动。人们将动物标本做成像是人的样子，如喝茶、看报、弹吉他等，别具一番趣味。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: from Greek taxis 'arrangement' + derma 'skin'

entry.def: Taxidermy is the craft of preparing the skins of dead animals and birds and filling them with a special material to make them look as if they are alive.

means.word_mean: 1. the art of mounting the skins of animals so that they have lifelike appearance

auth_sentence.content: Liz is best known for her marvelously strange faux-taxidermy sculptures.
